SBP.title: Roaming Broker
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This is the Roaming Broker feature required by operator VIVO. Once set to TRUE, NWSEL will sort available PLMN list with decreasing order.
SBP.NVRAM: Bit4 in byte[4](5th byte) of NVRAM_EF_RAC_PREFERENCE_LID

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable roaming broker support.
Enable roaming broker support

SBP.DEFAULT: Disable roaming broker
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12592

SBP.title: Autonomous Fast Return (AFR) for CSFB
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The UE may perform CSFB(circuit switched fallback) procedure from 4G to 2G/3G to obtain CS service; after call released, AFR feature enabled indicates if the 2G/3G network does not command the UE to perform redirection, the UE still can perform autonomous cell selection among the frequencies in AFR list to return to 4G. How to maintain AFR list is up to UE implementation.
SBP.NVRAM: b4 and b5 in 'csfb_enhancement_item_status' of NVRAM_EF_ERRC_PERFORMANCE_PARA_LID

CONFIG.VALUE: Indicate 2G AFR feature is disabled.
Indicate 2G AFR feature is enabled.
Indicate 3G AFR feature is disabled.
Indicate 3G AFR feature is enabled.

SBP.DEFAULT: Defaults setting of both 2G/3G AFR features are enabled.
SBP.NOTE: LSB of 'csfb_enhancement_item_status' represents csfb enhancement item b1; MSB represents csfb enhancement item b8.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk02407

SBP.title: Dynamic AFR (Autonomous Fast Return) setting depends on Home PLMN in IMSI
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The customer can configure 2G/3G AFR setting for different Home PLMN ids by modifying the following NVRMA file. Modem will search for the matched PLMN id got from IMSI, and use the corresponding AFR setting in NVRAM file.

CONFIG.VALUE: The designated PLMN wants to configure AFR feature setting.
Indicate 2G AFR feature is disabled under designated PLMN.
Indicate 2G AFR feature is enabled under designated PLMN.
Indicate 3G AFR feature is disabled under designated PLMN.
Indicate 3G AFR feature is enabled under designated PLMN.

SBP.DEFAULT: Default setting of this NVRAM file is empty (i.e. hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mcc1 = hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mcc2 = hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mcc3 = hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mnc1 = hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mnc2 = hplmn_afr_mapping[i].plmnid.mnc3 = 0x0f, for i = 0~7.)
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk02407

SBP.title: TMSI based NRI IE

DESCRIPTION.PARAG: If this option is enabled, UE will carry TMSI based NRI IE according to 8.2.4.17 and 8.2.29.23 of 3GPP TS 24.301:
DESCRIPTION.LI: The UE shall include this IE during a combined attach procedure if it has a valid TMSI.
The UE shall include this IE if it has a valid TMSI.
DESCRIPTION.PARAG: Although it is required in spec that UE should carry this IE if the above condition fulfilled, some networks are not capable to deal with this IE. Hence, MTK provides the flexibility to decide whether carry this IE or not.

SBP.NVRAM: Bit0 in byte[9](10th byte) of "feature_config" in NVRAM_EF_LTE_PREFERENCE_LID

CONFIG.VALUE: UE will not carry TMSI based NRI IE
UE will carry TMSI based NRI IE according to 3GPP TS 24.301

SBP.NOTE: This feature is available on all MTK modem.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk07903

SBP.title: Regional Phone
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to report the IMSI of current inserted SIM to AP during the very early stage of boot-up. By this IMSI, AP can launch location-specific power-on animation.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable modem Regional Phone feature
Enable modem Regional Phone feature

SBP.NOTE: This feature shall involve AP side Regional Phone feature.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk13380

SBP.title: Change supported LTE bands
SBP.DESCRIPTION: Supported LTE bands information in Capability message is got from the intersection of NVRAM supported bands setting and RF real supported bands.

CONFIG.VALUE: Support LTE band (i*8+j+1)
Not support LTE band (i*8+j+1)

SBP.DEFAULT: All LTE bands are supported.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: Change LTE FGI setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change LTE Feature Group Indicators (FGI) of UE capability.

CONFIG.VALUE: Used for FDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit1, LSB represents FGI bit32.
Used for TDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit1, LSB represents FGI bit32.
Used for FDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit33, LSB represents FGI bit64.
Used for TDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit33, LSB represents FGI bit64.
Used for FDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit101, LSB represents FGI bit132.
Used for TDD mode, total 32 bits, MSB represents FGI bit101, LSB represents FGI bit132.

SBP.DEFAULT: N/A
SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes capability reporting, but does not change real supported functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: Change LTE category setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change LTE category of UE capability.
SBP.DEFAULT: N/A
SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes capability reporting, but does not change real supported functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: Change UE capability setting of LTE r9_redirection feature
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change UE capability setting of LTE r9_redirection feature.

CONFIG_EXT.LI: Modify "irat_param_geram_v920.e_RedirectionGERAN_r9" to change the support of redirection from LTE to GERAN.
Modify "irat_param_utra_v920.e_RedirectionUTRA_r9_fdd/e_RedirectionUTRA_r9_tdd" to change the support of redirection from LTE to UTRAN.

SBP.DEFAULT: support
SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes capability reporting, but does not change real supported functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: Change ROHC Support Status in UE Capability Response
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change ROHC support status in UE capability response.
SBP.CONFIG_EXT:
Modify "pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[0~8]" to change the ROHC support status in Capability response.
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[0]: 0001_RPT
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[1]: 0002_UDP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[2]: 0003_ESP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[3]: 0004_IP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[4]: 0006_TCP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[5]: 0101_V2RTP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[6]: 0102_V2UDP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[7]: 0103_V2ESP
pdcp_param.rohc_profiles[8]: 0104_V2IP
Not support support
SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes ROHC support status in capability response, but does not change real supported ROHC functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: Change UE-EUTRA-capability
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change UE-EUTRA-capability reported in LTE RRC message UEInformationResponse.

CONFIG_EXT.TABLE_VALUE: ue_specific_ref_sigs\" in NVRAM file." value_width="0.5"> Not support Support
enhancedDualLayerFDD_r9\" in NVRAM file." value_width="0.5"> Not support Support
rach_Report_r9\" in NVRAM file." value_width="0.5"> Not support Support

SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes capability reporting, but does not change real supported functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12767

SBP.title: SDM SMS ADS Profile Setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION:
To fulfill operator's different strategies about to determinate the proper domain for sending SMS, we provide NVRAM_EF_SDM_ADS_PROFILE_LID to collect all relative setting.
SBP Description
always_cs_when_2g Always sending SMS over CS if camped on GSM
always_cs_when_3g Always sending SMS over CS if camped on UMTS
try_cs_when_2g_voice_call Always sending SMS over CS if 2G voice call is ongoing
enable_sms_over_sgs To enable SMS over SGs capability
prefer_sms_over_sgs_to_ims Prefer CS domain than IMS
prefer_retry_domain Which domain is preferred to retry if SMS is failing
enable_sms_over_wifi To enable SMS over WIFI capability
retry_cs_when_ims_tr1m_expiry Retry CS domain if IMS SMS failed due to TR1M expires
sdm_retry_timer Retry Timer for TEMPORARY ERROR or CP ERROR
imcsms_retry_for_202_rev retry SMS via CS if 202 is not recevied when sending IMS SMS
ims_smart_congestion_report_to_ap Report to AP start and end of an MO SMS over IP
allow_stk_over_ims To enable STK SMS over IMS capability

TABLE_VALUE.caption: sdm_retry_timer
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: the wating time for next retry if TEMPORARY ERROR or CP ERROR

TABLE_VALUE.caption: prefer_retry_domain.when_ims_fail
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: Never Retry if SMS over IMS is failing
Retry CS doamin if SMS over IMS is failing
Retry IMS doamin if SMS over IMS is failing

TABLE_VALUE.caption: prefer_retry_domain.when_cs_fail
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: Never Retry if SMS over CS is failing
Retry CS doamin if SMS over CS is failing
Retry IMS doamin if SMS over CS is failing

SBP.DEFAULT:
Defaults setting
SBP Default Setting
always_cs_when_2g 0 (Disable)
always_cs_when_3g 0 (Disable)
try_cs_when_2g_voice_call 0 (Disable)
enable_sms_over_sgs 1 (Enable)
prefer_sms_over_sgs_to_ims 0 (Disable)
prefer_retry_domain
when_ims_fail = 1 (Retry CS if IMS SMS fail)\n when_cs_fail = 0 (Never Retry if CS SMS fail)
enable_sms_over_wifi 1 (Enable)
retry_cs_when_ims_tr1m_expiry 0 (Disable)
sdm_retry_timer 0 (Disable)
imcsms_retry_for_202_rev 0 (Disable)
ims_smart_congestion_report_to_ap 0 (Disable)
allow_stk_over_ims 0 (Disable)
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12265

SBP.title: Voice domain preference
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This is voice domain preference setting for EUTRAN defined in TS 27.007 and TS 24.167. It's used for informing NW about UE preference for voice call domain. for example, voice call may go on CS or IMS domain depend on setting is CS voice only or IMS voice prefer.

CONFIG.VALUE: CS voice only.
CS voice prefer and IMS voice as secondary
IMS voice prefer and CS voice as secondary
IMS voice only

SBP.DEFAULT: 1, if not support VoLTE project
3, if support VoLTE project
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12592

SBP.title: UE's usage setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This is UE's usage setting for EUTRAN defined in TS 24.301. It's used for informing NW about UE usage is voice or data service mainly.

CONFIG.VALUE: Voice Centric.
Data Centric.

SBP.DEFAULT: 0, Voice Centric
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12592

SBP.title: SAIC and DARP support
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This is Single Antenna Interference Cancellation(SAIC) and Downlink Advanced Receiver Performance capability(DARP). this technique helps improve the receiver performance of GSM enabled DARP-1 compliant UE.
SBP.NVRAM: bit5 and bit4 in byte17 of NVRAM_EF_CLASSMARK_RACAP_LID

TABLE_VALUE.caption: configurable values for SAIC AND DARP Support
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: Downlink Advanced Receiver Performance not supported by UE
Downlink Advanced Receiver Performance Phase-1 supported by UE
Downlink Advanced Receiver Performance Phase-2 supported by UE
not used, if sent to NW, NW assumes as 10

SBP.NOTE: The modification only changes capability reporting, but does not change real supported functionalities.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk12655

SBP.title: SMS domain preference
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to select the preference of bearer service to send SMS.

CONFIG.VALUE: MO SMS will go through PS only
MO SMS will go through CS only
MO SMS will go through PS prefer
MO SMS will go through CS prefer

SBP.DEFAULT: If both compile option __CS_SERVICE__ and __SMS_OVER_PS_SUPPORT__ are defined, default is 1(CS only). If only compile option __SMS_OVER_PS_SUPPORT__ is defined, default is 0(PS only). Any other combinations of these 2 options, default is 1(CS only).
SBP.NOTE: The default value is decided by 2 compile options, __CS_SERVICE__ and __SMS_OVER_PS_SUPPORT__. If both compile option __CS_SERVICE__ and __SMS_OVER_PS_SUPPORT__ are defined, default is 1(CS only). If only compile option __SMS_OVER_PS_SUPPORT__ is defined, default is 0(PS only). Any other combinations of these 2 options, default is 1(CS only).
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09358

SBP.title: CB(Cell Broadcast) default on/off
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to set the default value of CB(cell Broadcast) on/off.

CONFIG.VALUE: CB off, UE cannot receive CB
CB on, UE can receive CB

SBP.DEFAULT: If on UE simulator, default is ON ; if not on UE simulator, default is OFF.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09358

SBP.title: UE receive all language of CB(Cell Broadcast)
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to set the UE can receive all language of CB(cell Broadcast) or not.

CONFIG.VALUE: Off. UE cannot receive all language of CB
On. allow UE can receive all language of CB

SBP.DEFAULT: ON
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09358

SBP.title: CB(Cell Broadcast) channels and languages configuration
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to configure CBMI, CBMIR and CB DCS (data coding scheme, language).

CONFIG_EXT.LI: cbmi[40] is in 81th ~ 160th byte (It allows 40 CBMI) cbmi_me_mask[5] is in 73th ~ 77th byte (each bit controls 1 CBMI in cbmi[]) You can put CBMI to cbmi[40] and set related mask to enable the CBMI. e.g. to enable CBMI 4370. Set "cbmi[0]=4370(81th byte 81 is 43, 82th byte is 70)" and set "first bit of cbmi_me_mask[0](most significant bit of 73th byte)" to 1.

You can configure CB channels in a range, for example 4370~4375. cbmir[30] is in 161th ~ 280th byte (It allows 30 ranges) cbmir_me_mask[4] is in 5th ~ 8th byte (each bit controls 1 range) e.g. to set a range 4370 ~ 4375. Set cbmir[0]=4370(161th byte is 43, 162th byte is 70), cbmir[1]=4375(163th byte is 43, 164th byte is 75) and set first bit of cbmir_me_mask[0](most significant bit of 5th byte) to 1.

dcs[30] is in 13th ~ 72th byte (It allows 30 languages) dcs_mask[4] is in 9th ~ 12th byte (each bit controls1 DCS in dcs[]) You can put language (according to TS23.038) to dcs[30] and set related mask to enable. e.g. to enable English and French. Set dcs[0]=1 (English), and set the first bit of dcs_mask[0](most significant bit of 9th byte) to 1.

SBP.DEFAULT: all CBMI and DCS are empty(0xFF). all cbmir_mask[], cbmir_me_mask[], dcs_mask[], cbmi_me_mask[] and cbmi_sim_mask[] are ON (0xFF).
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09358

SBP.title: Multislot Class Configuration
SBP.DESCRIPTION: GPRS multislot class / EGPRS multislot class refers to the different mobile station capabilities to transmit and receive on different combinations of multiple PDCHs. The multislot classes are defined in 3GPP TS 45.002. This field is to configure multislot class capability.
SBP.NVRAM: Bit6 to Bit2 of byte10 of NVRAM_EF_CLASSMARK_RACAP_LID

TABLE_VALUE.caption: Configurable Value of Multislot Class Configuration

SBP.DEFAULT: 01100 : Multislot Class 12
SBP.NOTE: MTK Modem Supports upto Multislot Class 12.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk08983

SBP.title: GPRS GEA Cipher Algorithm Support
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This field is to configure different type of ciphering algorithms for Encryption during GPRS/EGPRS data transfer. Encryption algorithm is used to protect user data from unauthorised access and misuse.

NVRAM.PARAG: Bit7 to Bit1 of byte11 of NVRAM_EF_CLASSMARK_RACAP_LID
Each Bit represents GEA/1 to GEA/7 independently.

TABLE_VALUE.caption: Configurable Value of GPRS GEA Cipher Algorithm Support
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/1 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/2 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/3 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/4 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/5 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/6 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/7 is Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/1 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/2 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/3 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/4 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/5 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/6 is Not Supported
GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/7 is Not Supported

SBP.DEFAULT: 1110000 : 0xE0 : GPRS Encryption Algorithm GEA/1, GEA/2 and GEA/3 is Supported.
SBP.NOTE: MTK Modem Supports GEA/1, GEA/2 and GEA/3 only. Please DO NOT modify GEA/4, GEA/5, GEA/6, and GEA/7 to be supported, otherwise it may cause GPRS Attach failure.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk08983

SBP.title: Prefer IMS as voice domain for emergency call in LTE limited service
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to set IMS as the voice domain preference for emergency call when the UE is under LTE limited service and both IMS and CS are available.

CONFIG.VALUE: Not prefer IMS. UE will choose CS domain as first emergency call attempt domain.
Prefer IMS. UE will choose IMS domain as first emergency call attempt domain

SBP.NOTE: This feature is available after UMOLY.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09297

SBP.title: Allow IMS emergency call with negative IMS voice over PS session indicator
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to control whether UE is allowed to attempt IMS emergency call under the circumstances that Network indicates IMS voice over PS session indicator is FALSE in Attach/TAU Accept.

CONFIG.VALUE: Not allowed. UE will not attemp IMS emergency call wehn IMSVoPS is not supported.
Allowed. UE could attemp IMS emergency call when IMSVoPS is not supported.

SBP.NOTE: This feature is available after UMOLY.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk09297

SBP.title: Orange Fast Dormancy
SBP.DESCRIPTION: As per the Orange operator requirement, this feature is to guard two consecutive SCRIs due to FastDormancy with 15sec when timer T323 sent by the network is 0.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable Orange Fast Dormancy. i.e no change in T323 when network send as 0
Enable Orange Fast Dormancy. i.e when network send T323 as 0, update T323 to 15 sec

SBP.DEFAULT: Disable Orange Fast Dormancy
SBP.NOTE: This feature can be turned on or off only if the modem supports Release 8 FastDormancy.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: EDPDCH Power Interpolation
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to control whether to enable EDPDCH power interpolation or not.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable EDPDCH power interpolation
Enable EDPDCH power interpolation

SBP.DEFAULT: Disable EDPDCH power interpolation
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Slot Format4
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to control whether to enable slot format4 or not.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable Slot format4
Enable Slot format4

SBP.DEFAULT: Enable Slot format4
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: UMTS integrity and ciphering
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to enable/disable UMTS integrity and ciphering
SBP.NVRAM: Bit 1 in integrity_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID Bit 2 of integrity_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID Bit 0 of cipher_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID Bit 1 of cipher_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID Bit 2 of cipher_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable UIA1
Enable UIA1
Disable UIA2
Enable UIA2
Disable UEA0
Enable UEA0
Disable UEA1
Enable UEA1
Disable UEA2
Enable UEA2

SBP.DEFAULT: Support integrity algorithm UIA1 and ciphering algorithms UEA0|UEA1.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: CPC(DTX-DRX) Configuration
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to perform Continuous Packet Connectivity (CPC) DTX/DRX operation in CELL_DCH state.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off CPC DTX/DRX feature
Turn on CPC DTX/DRX feature

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on CPC DTX/DRX operation feature
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: eFDPCH Configuration
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to support enhanced fractional DPCH.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off enhanced FDPCH support
Turn on enhanced FDPCH support

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on enhanced FDPCH support
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: FDPCH Configuration
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to support fractional DPCH.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off FDPCH support
Turn on FDPCH support

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on FDPCH support
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: UMTS Band Priority
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to change the band priority order during PLMN search in 3G. UE will search 3G cell according to the priority setting.

CONFIG_EXT.LI: Total size: 22 bytes (one byte for each band)

SBP.DEFAULT: 0xFF for all bands
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA capability
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to disable/enable capability of inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA FDD/TDD.
SBP.NVRAM: Bit3 in r8_cap1 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID for EUTRA FDD Bit7 in r8_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_FDD_LID for EUTRA TDD

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA FDD capability
Enable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA FDD capability
Disable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA TDD capability
Enable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA TDD capability

SBP.DEFAULT: Enable capability for inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: UMTS DMCR setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION: User can use this setting to control which operator (PLMN) need to disable DMCR feature. If UE try to camp on cells of these PLMNs, DMCR feature is disabled.

CONFIG.VALUE: The PLMN for which DMCR feature is disabled

SBP.DEFAULT: Default setting of this NVRAM file is empty (DMCR disabled for no PLMN) (i.e. disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc1 = disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc2 = disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc3 = disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc1 = disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc2 = disable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc3 = 0x0f).
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: UMTS SIB SKIP setting
SBP.DESCRIPTION: User can use this setting to control which operator (PLMN) need to enable SIB11/12 skipping for CSFB to 3G. If UE try to camp on cells of these PLMNs while CSFB is ongoing, SIB11/12 skipping is enable if DMCR not supported.

CONFIG.VALUE: The PLMN which enable DMCR feature.

SBP.DEFAULT: Default setting of this NVRAM file is empty empty (i.e. enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc1 = enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc2 = enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mcc3 = enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc1 = enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc2 = enable_PLMN[i].plmnid.mnc3 = 0x0f).
SBP.NOTE: i = 0~15 If DMCR is not supported by some operators, may use this setting to speed up the CSFB time. But there are highly potential risks those side effects (ex: call drop) may happen if implicitly skipping SIB11/12. Highly recommend 'NOT' to use this setting.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Enable Fast Dormancy in CPC
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to enable Fast Dormancy when CPC is configured.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable Fast Dormancy if CPC is configured.
Enable Fast Dormancy if CPC is configured.

SBP.DEFAULT: Enable Fast Dormancy when CPC is configured
SBP.OP: EU T-Mobile may need to disable Fast Dormancy when CPC is configured.
SBP.DEPENDENCY: This feature can be turned on/off only if the platform supports R8 FastDormancy.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Inhibit sending SCRI in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to inhibit sending SCRI due to Fast Dormancy in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH if configured.

CONFIG.VALUE: Don\'t send SCRI due to FastDormancy in Cell_PCH/URA_PCH state
Send SCRI due to FastDormancy in Cell_PCH/URA_PCH state

SBP.DEFAULT: Don\'t send SCRI due to FastDormancy in Cell_PCH/URA_PCH state.
SBP.DEPENDENCY: This feature can be turned on/off only if the modem supports Rel-8 FastDormancy
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: High Speed Cell FACH
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to enable High Speed Cell FACH if configured.

CONFIG.VALUE: HSDSCH Reception Disabled in CELL_FACH state
HSDSCH Reception Enabled in CELL_FACH state

SBP.DEFAULT: High Speed Cell FACH feature is enabled
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: High Speed Cell PCH
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to enable High Speed Cell PCH if configured.

CONFIG.VALUE: HSDSCH Reception Disabled in CELL_PCH and URA_PCH state
HSDSCH Reception Enabled in CELL_PCH and URA_PCH state

SBP.DEFAULT: High Speed Cell/URA PCH feature is enabled
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: High Speed RACH
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to enable High Speed RACH if configured.

CONFIG.VALUE: High Speed RACH feature is disabled
High Speed RACH feature is enabled

SBP.DEFAULT: High Speed RACH feature is enabled.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: TWO DRX SCHEMES
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to enable two DRX Schemes in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH states.

CONFIG.VALUE: Two DRX Scheme in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH states is disabled
Two DRX Scheme in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH states is enabled

SBP.DEFAULT: Two DRX Scheme in CELL_PCH/URA_PCH states is enabled.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: HSSCCH-less HSDSCH Operation
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to enable HSSCCH-less HSDSCH operation.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off HSSCCH-less HSDSCH feature
Turn on HSSCCH-less HSDSCH feature

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on HSSCCH-less HSDSCH feature
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: HSDSCH DRX operation
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to enable support for HSDSCH DRX operation.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off HSDSCH DRX operation feature
Turn on HSDSCH DRX operation feature

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on HSDSCH DRX operation feature
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Support for MAC-iis
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to enable support for MAC-iis.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off support for MAC-iis feature
Turn on support for MAC-iis feature

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on support for MAC-iis feature
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Support for MAC-ehs
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is to enable support for MAC-ehs.

CONFIG.VALUE: Turn off support for MAC-ehs feature
Turn on support for MAC-ehs feature

SBP.DEFAULT: Turn on support for MAC-ehs feature
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: Change supported GSM,WCDMA,TD-SCDMA Bands
SBP.DESCRIPTION: Supported GSM, TD-SCDMA, WCDMA bands can be modified by NVRAM
SBP.DEFAULT: All Bands are supported
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk9178

SBP.title: LTE AFR (Autonomous Fast Return) timer

DESCRIPTION.PARAG: This feature is used to set LTE AFR timer.
When this feature is enabled, during AFR to LTE procedure, UE would start AFR timer. If AFR timer expires and AFR procedure is not completed yet, it means AFR procedure fails.
When this feature is disabled, UE would not start AFR timer.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable. UE would not start AFR timer.
Enable. UE would start AFR timer with interval=1~255 seconds.

SBP.NOTE: This feature is available on LR9/LR11/LR12/LR12A.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk02481

SBP.title: LTE Priority Band

DESCRIPTION.PARAG: This feature is used to set LTE Priority Band.
When this feature is enabled, LTE band search order would be changed according to LTE Priority Band setting.
When this feature is disabled, LTE band search order would be decided by MTK internal algorithm.

A Priority Band record includes a PLMN/MCC and a band array. UE would apply band array as LTE band search order if PLMN/MCC is matched. If PLMN/MCC=0xffffff, it would match any PLMNs. You can set multiple records with different PLMN/MCCs. If none of records is matched, LTE band search order would be decided by MTK internal algorithm.
For example, if you set Priority Band records as above,
DESCRIPTION.LI: If selected PLMN is 46692f, LTE band search order would be 17->3->1->21.
If selected PLMN is 46630f, LTE band search order would be 3->17->1->21.
If selected PLMN is 45001f, LTE band search order would be 1->3->17->21.

CONFIG.VALUE: Number of LTE Priority Band records. Range=0~8. If priority_band_inf_num=0, it means disable.
PLMN id of the i-th LTE Priority Band record
Band number of the i-th LTE Priority Band record. Range=1~64.
Band array of the i-th LTE Priority Band record. band_list[]=N means band N. band_list[0] is the first search band, band_list[1] is the second search band, and so on.

SBP.DEFAULT: priority_band_inf_num = 0
SBP.NOTE: This feature is available on LR9/LR11/LR12/LR12A.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk02481

SBP.title: Repeated ACCH feature
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The repeated SACCH prodecure is explined below. If a downlink SACCH is incorrectly decoded and the next downlink is not the repitition, then as UE sets the SACCH REPITITION request in the next uplink SACCH block to - Repeated SACCH Required. If a downlink SACCH is correctly decoded and the next downlink is not the repitition as per Repeated Sacch procedure, then as UE sets the SACCH REPITITION request in the next uplink SACCH block to - Repeated SACCH notrequired.

TABLE_VALUE.caption: configurable values for Repeated ACCH feature
TABLE_VALUE.VALUE: Repeated ACCH feature is not supported by UE
Repeated ACCH feature is supported by UE

SBP.DEPENDENCY: The feature is controlled by a flag named __REPEATED_ACCH__.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk11225

SBP.title: Inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA capability (3G TDD)
SBP.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to disable/enable capability of inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA TDD/FDD.
SBP.NVRAM: Bit3 in r9_cap1 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_TDD_LID for EUTRA TDD. Bit6 in r9_cap3 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_TDD_LID for EUTRA FDD.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA TDD capability
Enable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA TDD capability
Disable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA FDD capability
Enable inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA FDD capability

SBP.DEFAULT: Enable capability of inter-RAT PS Handover to EUTRA
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk80702

SBP.title: UMTS integrity and ciphering (3G TDD)
SBP.DESCRIPTION: This feature is used to enable/disable UMTS integrity and ciphering
SBP.NVRAM: Bit1/Bit0 in integrity_cap2 and Bit2/Bit1/Bit0 in cipher_cap2 of NVRAM_EF_UMTS_USIME_RRC_DYNAMIC_CAP_TDD_LID.

CONFIG.VALUE: Disable UIA1
Enable UIA1
Disable UIA2
Enable UIA2
Disable UEA0
Enable UEA0
Disable UEA1
Enable UEA1
Disable UEA2
Enable UEA2

SBP.DEFAULT: Support integrity algorithm UIA1 and ciphering algorithms UEA0.
SBP.AUTHOR: mtk80702
